text: Brockman "Brock" Adams (January 13, 1927 â€“ September 10, 2004) was an American politician and member of Congress. Adams was a Democrat from Washington and served as a U.S. Representative, Senator, and United States Secretary of Transportation before retiring in January 1993. Adams died from Parkinson's disease in Stevensville, Maryland, aged 77. ==References== ==Other websites== *Voting record maintained by the Washington Post Category:1927 births Category:2004 deaths Category:Lawyers from Atlanta Category:Deaths from Parkinson's disease Category:Episcopalians Category:Harvard University alumni Category:United States representatives from Washington Category:United States Secretaries of Transportation Category:United States senators from Washington (state) Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians
title: Brock Adams
